text: When I feel a strong urge, I notice what emotion is driving it before I act.
During stressful moments, I pause and breathe before making any decision.
When I sense pressure building, I recognize the pattern and slow down my reactions.
When cravings appear, I react instantly without noticing what triggered them.
Before entering situations that feel risky, I prepare my mind and plan ahead.
When I notice my thoughts drifting toward escape, I stay aware of where my attention goes.
During moments of emptiness or boredom, I sense the pull and choose to wait instead of acting.
When emotions feel heavy, I follow the urge to numb them without understanding why they appeared.
I notice when my body feels overstimulated and I adjust before I crash.
When I see the early signs of slipping, I interrupt the pattern before it takes over.
During chaotic moments, I keep my routines steady instead of letting them break.
I enter vulnerable situations without predicting them or building protection ahead of time.
When I feel the pull toward relief, I understand what emotional need is driving it.
I notice when my mental energy feels drained and I protect my cognitive resources.
When I recognize a trigger, I see the full chain from thought to craving to action.
I treat cravings as commands that must be followed instead of signals I can observe.
When I feel overwhelmed, I change my physical environment or step away before reacting.
I notice when confusion or decision fatigue makes my urges feel stronger.
When I see patterns repeating, I recognize them early and interrupt the cycle.
I allow addiction to control my life without understanding the emotional pain behind it.
